comments:
After I perform a refactoring (rename a class), I get this error:

An internal error occurred during: "Refresh ExtractorParamsTest.java".

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match
outer scope rule:
L/servidor-ima/webIma/WEB-INF/src/fcc/ima/pdf/ExtractorParamsTest.java
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:117)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:211)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:190)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:96)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1674)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1240)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.refreshLocal(File.java:342)
	at org.vssplugin.ui.EditorUtils$4.runInWorkspace(EditorUtils.java:278)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:38)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

This is a bug in a third party plugin:

org.vssplugin.ui.EditorUtils

I suggest contacting the owner of that plugin.  The problem is that they are
running a job with a scheduling rule that locks a file, and then trying to
perform a workspace operation from within that job that requires more locking. I
suggest they look at Help > Help Contents > Platform Plugin Developers Guide >
Programmer's Guide > Resources overview > Modifying the workspace > Concurrency
and the workspace.
OK, I'll let them know about this bug.

traces.message: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: L/servidor-ima/webIma/WEB-INF/src/fcc/ima/pdf/ExtractorParamsTest.java
